org.helm.notation.tools

Class ComplexNotationParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.helm.notation.tools.ComplexNotationParser

  • public class ComplexNotationParser
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides methods that handle complex polymer extendendNotation. Complex Polymer Notation is based on graph theory, and uses simple polymer notation and chemical structure as building blocks. The following is a extendendNotation for complex polymer RNA1{R(A)P.[mR](U)P.R([BiA])P.R(C)P} |RNA2{R([BiA])P.R(U)P.R(G)P.R(C)P} |CHEM1{bLink} $RNA1,CHEM1,8:R2-1:R1 |CHEM1,RNA2,1:R2-2:R2 Complex notation will follow the following format starting 7/14/2008 NodeList$EdgeList$BasePairList$NodeLabelList$OtherTBD, where EdgeList, BasePairList, NodeLabelList and OtherTBD could be empty, but still keep the positional $ 1. Node List 2. Edge List 3. Base Pair List 4. Node Label List 5. OtherTBD Be careful that monomer XML may contain $, so we have to walk the notation from left to right
    Author:
    ZHANGTIANHONG

                                                  throws NotationException,
                                                         MonomerException
        The method generates the complex the notation for two complex notations combined. There will be no chemcial conection and base pairing between the components represented by each complex notation. *
        Parameters:
        complexNotation1 - -- complex notation for the first component to be combined
        complexNotation2 - -- complex notation for the second component to be combined
        Returns:
        the complex notation for the combined structure
        Throws:
        NotationException
        MonomerException

      • getMoleculeInfo

                                           org.jdom.JDOMException,
                                           chemaxon.marvin.plugin.PluginException,
                                           StructureException
        This method returns the MoleculeInfo of input polymer notation using the divide and conquer approach in SimpleNotationParser Should return the same result as StructureParser.getMoleculeInfo(String smiles) method, but runs faster for standard edges Ignore fuzzy edges in the calculation, good enough for large structures

        MoleculeInfo object
